page.title: 01Farming Lowland-Runic Cross
page.content: This square is a typical landscape of prosperous mixed farming, barley, grass and turnips to feed the sheep and cattle both dairy and store)from which the farmer makes his living. These farms until recently formed part of a large estate but were sold to the tenants thus increasing the number of farmers owning their farms. Local History-In the parish Church stands one of the 2 remaining Runic Crosses in britain known as the Ruthwell Cross. After many vicissitudes often broken and neglected it is now beautifully housed In the village of Ruthwell is the cottage (now a museum where the Rev Henry Duncan in the middle of the last century started the first Savings Bank in Britain.
